title: Dropbox stock gets a boost after Instinet turns bullish
text: Shares of Dropbox Inc. DBX, +2.74% are up 3.8% in premarket trading Tuesday after Instinet's Christopher Eberle upgraded the cloud storage stock to buy from neutral. "We believe we are nearing an inflection in revenue after six quarters of deceleration as a public company coupled with attractive valuation," he wrote, with the stock trading at 18 times 2020 estimates for adjusted free cash flow. Eberle expects that Dropbox will give more disclosure around key metrics including annual recurring revenue in the next few months. He sees upside to fourth-quarter estimates "as price increases have taken hold with manageable levels of churn." Eberle boosted his price target by a buck, to $25 from $24. Dropbox shares have struggled as of late, sinking 23% over the past three months compared with a 0.7% rise for the S&P 500 SPX, +0.69% in that span.
description: Shares of Dropbox Inc. are up 3.8% in premarket trading Tuesday after Instinet's Christopher Eberle upgraded the cloud storage stock to buy from neutral....
